name: Fast As Light
description: After an accident took the lives of a starship's crew, only holograms are left to keep the damaged ship intact. They have no intention of returning to the holodeck, but without help, their first voyage might become their last!
rules:
— Unique Supply Missions are available during the event. Open the Event to access them.
— Using any version of Dax, Kim, or Worf will provide a bonus to Supply Missions.
— Every Supply Mission you complete earns you Event Victory Points. Collect Event Victory Points to unlock Threshold Rewards!
— Community Rewards are only available during Phase 1. Collect Event Victory Points to unlock these rewards before the phase change!
— In this event, Squadrons may also compete to advance up the Squadron leaderboards. Join a Squadron to get more rewards!
bonus_text: Crew Bonus: Dax, Kim, or Worf
rewards_teaser: Reach Rank 1 by gaining Victory Points from Event Supply Missions!

featured_crew.name: Duchamps
featured_crew.flavor: After a transporter accident, Worf's image is used by a holosuite program to display Doctor Noah's henchman.

adventures.name: Keep the Lights On
adventures.description: Stabilize the ship's damaged warp core.

adventures.name: System Overload
adventures.description: Divert power to the computer to sustain holograms.

adventures.name: Life Support
adventures.description: Divert power to help the computer keep holograms running.

adventures.description: Help the holographic crew survive outside the holodeck.

rewards.name: Duchamps

rewards.name: 10x Portal
rewards.flavor: 10 valuable items. Go to Time Portal to collect!

goals.flavor: The Augments can make a starship into a home.
Non-solids can find a home in the Dominion.

next_threshold_rewards.name: Chronitons
next_threshold_rewards.flavor: Chronitons allow your crew to take action in these chaotic times. Use Chronitons to replay parts of past missions via the Timeline.

screens.text: "Captain... it's good to see someone with a flesh and blood face! When the Captain Proton holoprogram I was running malfunctioned, I realized I wasn't on Voyager anymore. I stepped out of the holodeck to find a ship full of holograms—and me the only real person onboard."

"It's been a challenge, corralling all these holograms from different programs and revealing to them what they really are, but they've all taken it pretty well. And thanks to a strange device this ship's crew was apparently transporting, they're able to help me crew the ship."

"We've kept her afloat since then, but we're losing power as we go. If it fails, all of these holograms will disappear, forever. They've become just as real to me as Voyager's EMH. They're my crew, and they're counting on me. From one captain-of-sorts to another, can I count on you to help?"

"I owe you one, Captain. The ship looks good as new and we're back to full power. Now that we know we're going to make it, the question is, where should we go? The problem with having so many different people aboard is, well, we don't all share the same priorities."

"As far as I or Federation salvage laws are concerned, this ship is ours. I'm happy to keep captaining it, as long as my crew supports me. We've also received an offer from the Augments, of technology that'll keep the crew, err... perpetually activated."

"Speak for yourself, Kincaid. I didn't get out of a photonic prison to spend the rest of my life on your ship! Section 31's offering something called mobile emitters that would let us walk out of here as free agents, and a few of us have skills they might appreciate."

"He does have a point about being stuck here. The ship's a nice way to travel, but I'd rather be on a planet, somewhere with room for my research. There's a group called the Dominion with land to spare on one of their worlds. Imagine what we could do with our own colony!"

responses.text: "What sort of help are the Augments offering, exactly?"
"Duchamps, do you trust Section 31 to give you the emitters they've promised?"
"Why would the Dominion take such an interest in some holograms?"

screens.text: "Multiple emitters all over the ship, backup power systems to keep them running—that sort of thing. I know about the Eugenics Wars, and the Augments' violent history... but we're all reinventing ourselves in this crisis. Maybe it's time for centuries-old prejudices to die."

"They'll have to if they want us going on missions outside of ships like this. I'm sure they have an insurance policy to keep us from running off with them, but as long as I've got one in my hands, I'll be leaving with it sooner or later."

"It'll take some getting used to, but the truth is, we're a different form of life than you, closer to the Dominion's Founders than anything else. Maybe they're just trying to do right by us. Whatever their reasons, they do have the technology to make a colony happen."

"I've dreamed of being captain. This might be the only chance I ever get. I'd like to take advantage of it, before an anomaly takes me back to being an ensign on the holodeck. But it is my first command... what would you advise, Captain? Where should we go?"
